creditline: Lent by Mona Hadary and Mahmoud Eldeeb
description: unframed and unstretched rectangular panel, black velvet with gold and silver embroidery; silver designs; arrow pointed downward at top center; two circles; horizontal long oval with pointed ends and four medallions in a row near bottom
text: Associated with the revelation of the word of God in the <I>Qura'n<I>, Arabic calligraphy has been considered the highest of art forms in Islamic cultures. Because of its association with Mohammed, the prophet of God, its importance is its presence rather than its legibility, which allows for considerable artistic freedom.A translation of the text of this piece and an accompanying guide to the placement of verses is available at the information desk in the Library.
title: Quranic Verses
